page.syntax: Code_Text as C = join.run(C layoutname [,C master_table_filter [,C transaction_table_filter [,L silent [,L show_xbasic [,* arguments ]]]]])

argument.name: Code_Text
argument.description: The Xbasic code that was run performing the operation.

argument.name: layoutname
argument.description: The name of a previously created join operation.

argument.name: master_table_filter
argument.description: Optional. Default = ".T." (All records). A character filter expression that evaluates to a logical value and selects the records from the master table.

argument.name: transaction_table_filter
argument.description: Optional. Default = ".T." (All records). A character filter expression that evaluates to a logical value and selects the records from the transaction table.

argument.name: silent
argument.description:
Optional. Default = .F.
.T. = No user interaction.
.F. = User interaction.

argument.name: show_xbasic
argument.description:
Optional. Default = .F.
.T. = Display the generated Xbasic code.
.F. = Do no display the generated Xbasic code.

page.discussion: The JOIN.RUN() method joins two tables using a previously defined join operation. Note : If you specify an optional filter argument, the filter is applied in addition to any filter that may have been defined as Part of the Operation. (You can check to see if a filter is defined as Part of an Operation by editing the saved operation, and selecting the "Select records" menu item.) If the Silent flag is set to .T., then Alpha Five does not display any confirmation dialog boxes before running the operation.
